content:
• Thursday, July 12, 2012
  • AMPE

    Ampio Pharmaceuticals (NYSEMKT:AMPE) -7.1% AH after announcing a stock offering of undisclosed...

    Ampio Pharmaceuticals (NYSEMKT:AMPE) -7.1% AH after announcing a stock offering of undisclosed size. Ampio, whose products are in the trial stage, has been bleeding cash. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • SIGM

    Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM) +3.3% AH after disclosing it has licensed its Z-Wave home networking...

    Sigma Designs (NASDAQ:SIGM) +3.3% AH after disclosing it has licensed its Z-Wave home networking protocol to an unnamed partner for $16.8M, which will be paid over the next 12 months. Z-Wave is aimed at low-bandwidth applications such as meter reading and lighting control.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:01 PM
  • ANGO

    AngioDynamics (NASDAQ:ANGO): FQ4 EPS of $0.09 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.08....

    AngioDynamics (NASDAQ:ANGO): FQ4 EPS of $0.09 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.08. Revenue of $57.7M (-5.9% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:14 PM
  • TWO

    Two Harbors (NYSE:TWO) announces a secondary offering of 35M shares. The company is the latest...

    Two Harbors (NYSE:TWO) announces a secondary offering of 35M shares. The company is the latest in a line of mortgage REITs taking advantage of a share price trading nicely above book value. Two Harbors latest reported book value (March 31) was $9.67 - today's close, $10.72. Shares -1.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM | 2 Comments
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) +7.3% AH after announcing a $200M stock buyback plan, good for...

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) +7.3% AH after announcing a $200M stock buyback plan, good for repurchasing 18.6% of outstanding shares as of today's close. Acme, which had over $400M in cash and investments as of March 31, has been clobbered by a string of warnings and guidance cuts, the most recent of which arrived last week. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • LXK

    Lexmark (LXK -7.5%) closes the day off sharply following a downgrade to Sell from Barclays' Ben...

    Lexmark (LXK -7.5%) closes the day off sharply following a downgrade to Sell from Barclays' Ben Reitzes, who predicts managed printing services and the growing popularity of mobile photo viewing/sharing will continue hurting print volumes. Managed services are "driving more volume to fewer mid-range printers," he notes. Estimates are also cut for H-P (NYSE:HPQ) and Xerox (NYSE:XRX) - the former has voiced similar concerns about mobile's impact on printing. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM

  • Ignore today's dive in Sprott Physical Silver Trust (PSLV -3.8%, with SLV +0.3%) on the back of...

    Ignore today's dive in Sprott Physical Silver Trust (PSLV -3.8%, with SLV +0.3%) on the back of about a $200M follow-on offering, writes Brendan Conway. Sprott is simply turning the fund's premium to NAV into cash with which to buy more silver - exactly what an owner of the shares wants to see.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM | 12 Comments
  • PG

    Shares of Procter & Gamble (PG +4.2%) trade at a session high after Bill Ackman says Pershing...

    Shares of Procter & Gamble (PG +4.2%) trade at a session high after Bill Ackman says Pershing Square's position in the company is the largest investment the hedge fund has ever made.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • DGX

    Quest Diagnostics (DGX +4.3%) surges, thanks to a 1996 deal with Merck over osteoporosis drug...

    Quest Diagnostics (DGX +4.3%) surges, thanks to a 1996 deal with Merck over osteoporosis drug odanacatib, which may pay off to the tune of $75M. (earlier: success of odanacatib)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +11.7%) soars, and subsidiary Cheniere Partners (CQP +3.6%) posts a smaller...

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +11.7%) soars, and subsidiary Cheniere Partners (CQP +3.6%) posts a smaller gain, after the latter states it has received $3.4B in lender commitments for its giant Sabine Pass natural gas liquefaction project. The commitments come on top of $2B in equity financing that has been lined up, and allow CQP to cancel plans for a $1.25B term loan facility. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 12 Comments
  • P

    Easy come, easy go. Pandora (P +3.9%) gives back a chunk of its gains as a source claims Comcast...

    Easy come, easy go. Pandora (P +3.9%) gives back a chunk of its gains as a source claims Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) isn't bidding on the Internet radio leader, as was rumored. 36.7% of Pandora's float was shorted as of June 15, making short squeezes easy to come by.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • SQBG

    Shares of Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia (MSO +4.4%) knock out a gain after the company...

    Shares of Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia (MSO +4.4%) knock out a gain after the company broadens an existing deal with J.C. Penney to include more of its categories inside J.C. Penney stores.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • MSFT

    PC-related names underperform a bit following weak Q2 data from Gartner and IDC. MSFT -1.6%....

    PC-related names underperform a bit following weak Q2 data from Gartner and IDC. MSFT -1.6%. INTC -1.8%. DELL-OLD -1.4%. HPQ -1.8%. NVDA -1.5%. Dell and H-P's share losses are raising eyebrows: the companies are struggling to deal with competition from Apple, and from a slew of Asian manufacturers (headlined by Lenovo) competing aggressively on price. Intel has seen several estimate cuts in recent weeks, and Microsoft received one from Morgan Stanley yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • P

    Rumors of a potential takeover of Pandora (P +5.9%) center on Comcast (CMCSA -1.1%), although...

    Rumors of a potential takeover of Pandora (P +5.9%) center on Comcast (CMCSA -1.1%), although the marriage of the two companies and distinct personalities doesn't quite make sense to industry watchers. Shares of Pandora are off session highs, but still trade strong on heavy volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • CZR

    Shares of Caesars Entertainment (CZR -5.7%) suffer the sharpest drop of major players in the...

    Shares of Caesars Entertainment (CZR -5.7%) suffer the sharpest drop of major players in the gaming sector after Nevada gambling revenue numbers comes in weak for May (I, II). The company was the hardest hit due to its large exposure to the Las Vegas Strip.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • P

    Pandora (P +7.8%) soars in early afternoon trading. Takeover speculation appears to be the...

    Pandora (P +7.8%) soars in early afternoon trading. Takeover speculation appears to be the reason. (recent: I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • APC

    Anadarko Petroleum (APC +3%) spikes higher following a Reuters report that the company will take...

    Anadarko Petroleum (APC +3%) spikes higher following a Reuters report that the company will take part in settlement talks with former subsidiary Tronox Trust. Tronox, which filed for bankruptcy in 2009, is suing Anadarko for $25B on behalf of the EPA and other creditors, who claim Anadarko transferred funds belonging to creditors out of Tronox prior to the filing.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • CRUS

    Chip stocks underperform (SOXX -2.1%) after Nomura's Romit Shah says his firm "cannot make a...

    Chip stocks underperform (SOXX -2.1%) after Nomura's Romit Shah says his firm "cannot make a fundamental argument for being long any semiconductor stocks in today’s environment." On a relative basis, Shah recommends buying Apple component suppliers. Some chipmakers with heavy Apple explosure: CRUS, OVTI, SWKS, TQNT, BRCM. Deutsche made the opposite call on chip stocks yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM

  • In response to the USDA's reduced corn crop forecast, Barclays is raising its price forecasts...

    In response to the USDA's reduced corn crop forecast, Barclays is raising its price forecasts for corn, soy, wheat, and other soft commodities. That's helping some agriculture ETFs rally on a down day. CORN +2.8%. WEAT +2.1%. SOYB +0.8%. JJG +2%. GRU +2.1%. JJA +1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4.1%) move lower with cautious comments from...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -4.1%) move lower with cautious comments from Detwiler Fenton circulating about. A biting SA article calling into question the company's accounting numbers is also raising some eyebrows.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 2 Comments
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +15.65%) after announcing that its partner, Takeda Pharmaceuticals, has signed...

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY +15.65%) after announcing that its partner, Takeda Pharmaceuticals, has signed an agreement to supply their anemia treatment Omontys to U.S. dialysis centers run by Germany's Fresenius Medical Care. Fresenius (FMS -2.1%) intends to initially use the drug in 100 centers before expanding the program. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM) +15.8% on heavy volume. CEO Steven King was due to make a...

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM) +15.8% on heavy volume. CEO Steven King was due to make a presentation today at the JMP Securities Healthcare Conference in New York. In May, Peregrine announced positive results from a Phase IIb trial of its bavituximab lung cancer treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • MBI

    MBIA (MBI +4.1%) climbs after MKM Partners says regulators look to be pushing the company...

    MBIA (MBI +4.1%) climbs after MKM Partners says regulators look to be pushing the company to settle its lawsuit with BofA and SocGen. The stock plunged earlier this week when the NYSDFS wouldn't give the okay for the company to make a scheduled loan payment. MKM figures it was the regulator's way of saying the lawsuit has gone on long enough. (ZH with the relevant court transcript).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • PG

    Procter & Gamble (PG +3.1%) adds to early gains as more reports circulate that Pershing...

    Procter & Gamble (PG +3.1%) adds to early gains as more reports circulate that Pershing Square will take (or already has) a position in the company after landing FTC approval to hold shares. Pershing Square didn't hold any shares of P&G at the end of March, according to its Q1 SEC filing. (Earlier on PG: Glass half full vs. glass half empty)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • BJK

    State gambling regulators in Nevada say casino revenue in the state fell 10% Y/Y in May to...

    State gambling regulators in Nevada say casino revenue in the state fell 10% Y/Y in May to $885M, led by a sharp drop in action on the Las Vegas Strip. Casino stocks (BJK -1.9%) trade moderately lower off the news, with the impact of the headline number tempered somewhat by a month-to-month revenue trend which showed a 3.4% gain.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • MRK

    Leerink Swann calls the early success of Merck's (MRK +4.2%) odnacatib osteoporosis drug a...

    Leerink Swann calls the early success of Merck's (MRK +4.2%) odnacatib osteoporosis drug a "positive upside surprise," and forecasts peak sales of $975M in 2020, and a total global sales potential of $3B+. Leerink Swann also maintains its Outperform rating on Merck's stock, while Citigroup ups its rating to "buy" from "neutral."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -3.4%) continues to have an ugly July - shares are now down 28% from the beginning...

    Groupon (GRPN -3.4%) continues to have an ugly July - shares are now down 28% from the beginning of the month. Worries about leadership, marketing spend, and Euro exposure all seem to be taking a toll ahead of the company's Q2 report, expected near the end of the month.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • LDK

    Piper is downgrading four solar names - LDK Solar (LDK -4.4%), Trina Solar (TSL -5%), Yingli...

    Piper is downgrading four solar names - LDK Solar (LDK -4.4%), Trina Solar (TSL -5%), Yingli (YGE -3.2%), and JA Solar (JASO -4.5%), while upgrading two others - Canadian Solar (CSIQ +1.4%) and SunPower (SPWR +0.2%). The downgrades relate to worries about pricing and margins, though LDK's high debt load is also discussed. The CSIQ and SPWR upgrades stem from optimism about the companies' project installation and U.S. residential ops, respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 2 Comments
  • CP

    Goldman Sachs takes up coverage on railroad stocks again with a bullish view that the...

    Goldman Sachs takes up coverage on railroad stocks again with a bullish view that the transportation industry has more upside after years of near stagnation. The firm adds Canadian Pacific (CP -0.5%) to its Conviction Buy List and tags CSX (CSX -1.5%) with a Buy rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 4 Comments
  • UAL

    Shares of United Continental (UAL -4.2%) fall harder than peers after the carrier confirms its...

    Shares of United Continental (UAL -4.2%) fall harder than peers after the carrier confirms its blockbuster buy of 737s. A four-letter word from Goldman Sachs - SELL - seems to be trumping any residual excitement over the expected UAL announcement with delivery for the new jets not slated until 2018 at the earliest.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • AZO

    Auto parts sellers show relative strength against a weak tape. Today's job report highlighting...

    Auto parts sellers show relative strength against a weak tape. Today's job report highlighting the reduction in auto plant closings and the decrease in summer shutdowns could be helping to sway sentiment. Outperformers: AZO +3.7%, ORLY -0.1%, AAP -0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • VLNCQ

    Valence Technology (VLNC) files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy. The company, a developer of...

    Valence Technology (VLNC) files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy. The company, a developer of lithium-ion batteries for vehicles and other high-power equipment, had already disclosed board resignations and a delisting notice yesterday afternoon. Rival A123 Systems (AONE +1.7%), which has its own cash flow problems, isn't showing any ill effects.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 8 Comments
  • CALX

    Telecom equipment and optical component names fell yesterday due to Adtran's results, and today...

    Telecom equipment and optical component names fell yesterday due to Adtran's results, and today they're underperforming with the help oft Calix's (CALX -25.5%) warning. JDSU -3.3%. ALLT -4.9%. ADTN -3.6%. JNPR -2.7%. FNSR -2.8%. Aside from macro conditions, wireline telecom capex budgets are being pressured by the data demands of mobile networks, and the heavy debt loads of Euro carriers. Juniper reports on July 23.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • SVU

    It's not a 2-for-1 split, Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) actually trades 47% lower after bombing with its...

    It's not a 2-for-1 split, Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) actually trades 47% lower after bombing with its earnings report. Sell-side analysts are taking a beating in the Twittersphere after the retailer's free cash flow yield and M&A potential stoked positive comments over the last few months, while (as expected) collateral damage in the sector is playing out. SWY -9.0%, KR -3.3%, WFM -1.2%, DEG -2.7%, HTSI -1.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • LVS

    Casino stocks open lower with a report (.pdf) out from the Nevada State Gaming Board that...

    Casino stocks open lower with a report (.pdf) out from the Nevada State Gaming Board that gambling revenue from Las Vegas Strip casinos fell 18.15% in May. Decliners: LVS -2.8%, MGM -3.1%, MPEL -2.7%, WYNN -1.8%), CZR -1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 2 Comments
  • MITL

    VirnetX (VHX +6.9%) pops after settling its patent infringement dispute with Mitel...

    VirnetX (VHX +6.9%) pops after settling its patent infringement dispute with Mitel (NASDAQ:MITL). The settlement will result in VirnetX receiving a one-time licensing fee and future royalties on sales of Mitel's enterprise IP communications hardware. The agreement follows a similar licensing deal with Aastra in May, and comes as VirnetX remains locked in disputes with Apple, Cisco, and NEC. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • PSLV

    Sprott Physical Silver Trust (PSLV -5.1%) dives after it raises about $200M from a follow-on...

    Sprott Physical Silver Trust (PSLV -5.1%) dives after it raises about $200M from a follow-on offering priced at $11.05/share. The funds will be used to - what else - purchase additional bullion. It's a closed-end fund and yesterday's 7.2% premium to NAV has clearly narrowed. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • SAP

    SAP +3.9% after reporting preliminary Q2 revenue of €3.9B ($4.75B), up 18% Y/Y and above a...

    SAP +3.9% after reporting preliminary Q2 revenue of €3.9B ($4.75B), up 18% Y/Y and above a consensus of €3.8B. Software revenue was €1.06B (+26% Y/Y), and operating profit was €0.92B. SAP's software growth soundly exceeded the 7% license growth delivered by archrival Oracle (NYSE:ORCL) in its May quarter, as well as its 0%-10% guidance for the August quarter. The results are a breath of fresh air for enterprise software following warnings from Informatica and Qlik.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM
  • PG

    Quick reaction on Pershing Square's interest in Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG): The glass half full...

    Quick reaction on Pershing Square's interest in Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG): The glass half full camp sees investors benefiting if Ackman uses his influence to spur P&G to spin off brands, while the glass half empty side focuses on Pershing Square's souring investment in J.C Penney. PG +2.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM
  • PG

    Shares of Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) move up 2.5% premarket after a transaction from...

    Shares of Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) move up 2.5% premarket after a transaction from Pershing Square lands FTC early termination status to move forward. (.pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM

  • Market Preview: Futures pare losses a bit after slightly better-than-expected - albeit...

    Market Preview: Futures pare losses a bit after slightly better-than-expected - albeit unconvincing - weekly jobless claims. The S&P benchmark is -0.7%. Along with Warren Buffett, markets in the U.S. and Europe are depressed about the global economy. Meanwhile, Supervalu dives 36% after a horrible earnings report and is dragging down its rivals with it. Later: Bloomberg Consumer Comfort Index
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 2 Comments
  • INFY

    Infosys' (NASDAQ:INFY) guidance cut takes a toll on other IT outsourcing names. CTSH -3.8%. SAPE...

    Infosys' (NASDAQ:INFY) guidance cut takes a toll on other IT outsourcing names. CTSH -3.8%. SAPE -2.7% ACN -1.1%. Wipro (NYSE:WIT) fell 4% on the Mumbai exchange. Infosys also issued a disappointing Q1 report in April, and it was followed by an equally bad report in May from Cognizant. Europe's weak economy and currency are clearly problems, though Gartner has long been voicing concerns about the impact of cloud services on outsourcing.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • GNOM

    Premarket gainers: GNOM +10%. VHC +7%. Losers: SVU -36%. INFY -10%. IMGN -6%. NMFC -5%. PGR -5%.

    Premarket gainers: GNOM +10%. VHC +7%.
    Losers: SVU -36%. INFY -10%. IMGN -6%. NMFC -5%. PGR -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • JCP

    Shares of J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) slip another 1% premarket and dip below the $20 mark briefly as...

    Shares of J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) slip another 1% premarket and dip below the $20 mark briefly as the retailer remains in the sights of critics. Interestingly, the stock is starting to get held up by some traders as a real estate play, which is one of the arguments that has helped prop up shares of Sears Holdings amidst its slicing and dicing this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • GNOM

    Complete Genomics (NASDAQ:GNOM) +9.2% premarket and adding to a surge of 44% yesterday after it...

    Complete Genomics (NASDAQ:GNOM) +9.2% premarket and adding to a surge of 44% yesterday after it announced that its Long Fragment Read (LFR) technology, a new way of mapping DNA, "dramatically improves accuracy...and significantly reduces" the amount required for testing." That should make it more accessible to patients. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM
  • SVU

    Grocery store stocks look set to feel the sting from Supervalu's (NYSE:SVU) earnings report...

    Grocery store stocks look set to feel the sting from Supervalu's (NYSE:SVU) earnings report disaster that has sent its shares into a 31% nosedive premarket. On watch: Safeway (NYSE:SWY) -3.8%, Kroger (NYSE:KR) -2.2%, Winn-Dixie (NASDAQ:WINN) inactive.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM

  • Asian markets are broadly down, with lots of divergent data to digest (Korea rate cut, Japan APP...

    Asian markets are broadly down, with lots of divergent data to digest (Korea rate cut, Japan APP shuffle, India industrial output, Aussie joblessness). China's the outlier, +0.4%. Japan -1.5%. Hong Kong -1.9%. India -1.6%. Korea -2.2%. Australia -0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 AM

  • Australia's jobless rate rose for a second month, to 5.2% in June from 5.1% in May. The number...

    Australia's jobless rate rose for a second month, to 5.2% in June from 5.1% in May. The number of people employed fell by 27K, led by essentially erasing a revised 27,800 job gain in May. Aussie dollar -0.8% to $1.0168. ASX 200 index -0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 AM | 2 Comments
